intro: Graffenrieda laevicarpa, commonly known as the smooth-fruited graffenrieda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its fruits are smooth and capsule-like, containing several seeds. Graffenrieda laevicarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
